title: Power of a Product Rule
text: For any real numbers a and $$b$$ and any integer $$n$$, the power of a product rule of exponents states that $${ab}^n=a^n b^n$$
speech: For any real numbers a and  b  and any integer  n , the power of a product rule of exponents states that  a b to the n-th is equal to, a to the n-th b to the n-th
pacedSpeech: For any real numbers a and   b
, the power of a product rule of exponents states that   a b to the n-th is equal to, a to the n-th b to the n-th

title: Power of a Product Rule
text: Use the power of a product rule to simplify the expression: $${\left({ab}^2\right)}^3=$$ $$a^3 {\left(b^2\right)}^3$$

title: Power Rule of Exponents
text: For any real number a and positive integers $$m$$ and $$n$$, the power rule of exponents states that $${\left(a^m\right)}^n=a^{m n}$$
speech: For any real number a and positive integers  m  and  n , the power rule of exponents states that , parentheses a to the m-th  to the n-th is equal to, a raised to the m n power
pacedSpeech: For any real number a and positive integers   m
, the power rule of exponents states that  ,  a to the m-th  to the n-th is equal to, a raised to the m n power

title: Power Rule of Exponents
text: Use the power rule to simplify the expression: $$a^3 {\left(b^2\right)}^3=a^{1\times3} b^{2\times3}$$
speech: Use the power rule to simplify the expression:  a cubed times, parentheses b squared  cubed is equal to a raised to the 1 times 3 power, b raised to the 2 times 3 power
